title: Restoring bookmarks after changing Firefox Account password

If I change my password, I may lose my bookmarks, etc. I exported the bookmarks to html and also backed them up (json). If I change my password, will I be able to restore the bookmarks using one of those backups? I backed up "all bookmarks." Does that include the bookmarks toolbar and mobile bookmarks as well as the bookmarks menu and other bookmarks? Thank you in advance!

title: How to export bookmarks from Firefox when Firefox won't load?
content: Hello. I have a (presumably) broken install of Firefox that never loads and I plan to totally uninstall Firefox (I have the beta version and I plan to get the normal version, unless you guys have a better solution to try), but first I just need to salvage my carefully curated bookmarks from this install before I nuke it (uninstall, do a clean-up, and reinstall a totally different version). Since normally once has to open the browser and enter settings (or bookmarks perhaps, I forget the exact process off the top of my head and clearly can't go look) to export bookmarks, I'm at a loss of how to accomplish this task. I've included a screenshot of what Firefox does when I open it. No amount of waiting does any good, this is all it does, and this is all it has done for over a year, despite numerous updates. Clearly the install is corrupted and I need to start fresh, but I need those bookmarks if at all possible. Is it possible? I've just switched to Chrome for the past year hoping it would eventually work itself out with an update, but that was clearly wishful thinking. I actually hate Chrome and would really like to get back to using Firefox, but I've let this linger for a year because I really do not want to lose those bookmarks and doing nothing and having a case of Schrodinger's bookmarks is somewhat better than having bookmarks that are gone forever.

content:

I called my bank's support line and and they say it's a Firefox issue. They talked me through clearing my cookies and cache. They even talked me through refreshing Firefox. None of that worked. On my own, I uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, but to no avail.

I am able to log into the bank using Firefox on my PC laptop. Does anyone have any suggestions about why the Mac version of Firefox stopped talking to my bank and advice on how to solve the problem?

title: Evernote web clipper disappears from Firefox task bar
content:
Here is my exchange with the evernote helpdesk: scarry! It seems that Evernote webclipper won't work unless it can extract data... How could this be fixed?

my orginal query

Anne-Lise Sibony Feb 7, 2021, 2:15 PST

Dear Evernote team, my evernote plugin (webclipper) has disappeared from my task bar on Firefox and I cannot seem to put it back. I have reinstalled the plugin in Firefox (multiple times). So the plugin is there (see screenshot) but the Evernote icon does not show in the task bar (see screenshot). I have tried all I could think of (starting with drag and drop) to bring the little elephant back where it normally grazes but in vain. Could you please help?

Attachment(s) Capture d’écran 2021-02-07 à 11.05.00.png Capture d’écran 2021-02-07 à 11.07.41.png

Evernote's response Camila (Evernote Help and Learning) Feb 8, 2021, 0:26 PST

Hello Anne,

Thank you for getting in touch with Evernote Customer Support. I'm Camila, and I'm glad to assist you today.

I'm sorry to hear that you are not able to use Web Clipper on Firefox, despite reinstalling it for many times.

If you're currently on Private Mode browsing in Firefox, please know that Web Clipper is currently not available in Private Mode browsing. This feature will be reintroduced in a future release.

The workaround for this is to disable Private Mode browsing, or use another browser to use Web Clipper.

Thanks for understanding regarding this matter.

Best,

Camila S. Customer Support Representative

my dismayed comment De: Anne-Lise Sibony <alsibony@gmail.com> Objet: Rép : Ticket# 3258160 - Firefox plugin has disappeared Date: 8 février 2021 à 09:42:03 UTC+1 À: support-webform@evernote.com

Hello Camila,

Thank you for getting back to me.

I am sorry to hear that evernote web clipper has been designed to demand tracking in order to function. I pay with money for the service and I do not feel it is fair that I have no choice but to consent to data extraction in order to get the service I pay for.

This said, I have for now switched Firefox to « standard » mode but, unfortunately, it does not help. After switching to standard mode, I have quit Mozilla and reopened it, then opened the extensions menu and tried to drag the Evernote icon to my task bar but to no avail.

Can you suggest something else I might try?

Do you have visibility as to when evernote web clipper will be compatible with Firefox, whatever the user settings?

Many thanks for your help,

Anne-Lise

title: Firefox 85.Sürüm Gömülü PDF yazdırma raporu ayarları Hakında
content:
Öncelikli olarak Firefox benin vazgeçilmez tarayıcımdır. Geliştirici ve Desdekçilere sonsuz Teşekkürlerimi sunarım.

Yazdırma alanında ki sayfa ayarlarının yapıldığını öğrendik. Ancak Oransal olarak (Yani % 90 veya % 80 gibi) yapılan ayarlamalarda A4 Kağıdı üzerinde tam bir orantısallık sağlanamamaktadır. Kağıdın Sol Kenar boşluğu sabit kalmakta Sağ kenar boşluğu büyümektedir. Sizde takdir edersiniz ki dosyalamak veya yetkiliye ibraz etmek için böyle bir çıktı hoş olmayacaktır. Yani anlatmak istediğim olay şudur % li ayar yapılan A4 kağıtta % lik oransal olarak Kağıdın Sol Kenar Boşluğu, Sağ Kenar Boşluğu Üst Kenar Boşluğu ve Alt Kenar Boşluğu aynı olmalıdır.

Bu konu üzerinde saygıdeğer gelistiricilerin ve desdekçilerinin ilgileneceğine olan inancımla teşekkür ederim.

content:
Hello,

we use the latest "normal" Firefox on a Terminalserver with Windows 2016 Std. (no firefox ESR version is used, no central firefox GPO) are in use

Users reported that they got a new empty firefox profil after firefox updates on the terminalserver.

I saw below articles and I am not sure what is the best solution to avoid the a.m. problem. Can you give a advice? Thx + best regards

Our goal is: using firefox on terminalserver, function/policy for "non-update-automatic" would be no problem"


https://support.mozilla.org/de/kb/wiederherstellen-fehlender-nutzerdaten-nach-update "kann passieren, da Firefox ab Version 67 nach einem Update ein neues dedicated profile for each Firefox installation erstellt und damit startet.

"So stellen Sie Ihre Firefox-Daten und -Einstellungen aus einem anderen Profil wieder her" https://support.mozilla.org/de/kb/firefox-profile-sichern-und-wiederherstellen https://support.mozilla.org/de/kb/wiederherstellen-wichtiger-daten-aus-altem-profil#w_sicherheitszertifikats-einstellungen

title: Firefox crashs on WSL 2 saying "Channel Error: cannot send/recv" even after usual treamtent
content:
Hello, 

    I've got stacked when using Firefox on my WSL 2 instance. I introduced firefox on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS on WSL 2 as usual, and starting from the command line produced the following error messages:
      1. !!! [Parent][RunMessage] Error: Channel error: cannot send/recv 
  The browser starts with a window from WSL 2 command line, but all tabs repeat crashes and cannot use any more.   My full error messages are attached as a text file in this post. 
  Ordinarily, this glitch can be solved by using a hack that shows "about:config" and proceed with changing settings of two values of entry "browser.tabs.remote.autostart" and "browser.tabs.remote.autostart" to false.  Actually my other firefox instace on WSL could solve this problem, but this time, I cannot solve this. Firefox keeps crashing after altering these two settings. 
  I tried to make some other workarounds, such as manipulating  SELinux parater mozilla_plugin_can_network_connect to "-1", but I found SELinux was disabled in my WSL 2 at all.  
 I guess something on IPC function is missing or broken, due to for example lack of appropriate packages, but I cannot specify the solution. 
 Here is my enviroment in trouble:
  • Firefox version: 85.0 (latest on Ubuntu)
  • OS version: 20.04 LTS (with all latest patches applied)
  • System: WSL 2 (on Windows 10 Pro 20H2 64 bit)
  • X Application: VcXsrv 1.20.9.0 (maybe the latest) 
  Other GUI applications run flawlessly as far as I confirm. 
  Any comments and suggestions appreciated.
creator: terakinizers

title: Shopify Admin pages don't refresh
content:
FreeBSD 12.2 Firefox 85.0 (64-bit) - no extensions (removed uBlock Origin, Privacy Badger, HTTPS ONLY)

>> Enhanced Tracking Protection: OFF for shopify URIs >> Privacy & Security set to Standard >>>Manage Exceptions contains shopify URIs >> Block Pop-Ups contains shopify URI as exception >> HTTPS-ONLY Mode enabled

PROBLEM: see Subject At first I thought that Firefox's protection from these super-cookies they're so proud of actually hampered my browsing. However, after toggling through HTTPS-ONLY modes is appears that having this 'feature' disabled is what allows me to browse normally without a false negative of "This page is not available at this moment".

I wanted to put this out there in case anyone else has a Shopify store, uses v85 of Firefox and has similar difficulties.

Curious to hear whether the Firefox devs have any feedback ... thing is, with uBlock I have control over which domains, sub-domains and cross-domains I want to allow in terms of javascript et al while Privacy Badger used to control cookies. With Firefox's built-in protection it's more static ... still have a feeling that's where the problem is but will need to spend a little more time to draw any conclusions on my end. Maybe the built-in dev tools will shed some additional light?

Incidentally, the Chrome browser has no problem.
creator: firefox1233

title: unable to log into ebay using firefox
content:
When I went to log into ebay tonight, using mozilla firefox, I am unable to log into either one of my accounts. I get the message: Confirm your account

It looks like you signed in from a different computer. Before you continue, we need to verify your identity and confirm it's really you. Choose how you'd like to receive your confirmation code

We'll send a message to the option you select. 

   By Phone (voice or text)    By Email

Cancel


I have tried the option to receive a pin code both by text and phone call numerous times but it keeps coming back to this saying I need to confirm my account. I am using mozilla firefox on a windows 10 computer. I did try windows edge browser and was able to get in to both of my accounts on my windows 10 computer. However, I use and prefer firefox. Also, I have a windows 7 computer and I was able to log into both of my accounts using firefox. I was able to log into my ebay accounts before I updated firefox last night. I'm not sure if the new firefox update has anything to do with the problem on my windows 10 computer. I also updated firefox on my windows 7 computer and I can still log into my ebay accounts using firefox.

title: Can I sort Bookmarks Menu with newest on top?
content: I want to start using the Bookmarks Menu. However, when I open it and mouse over the folder I want to look in, the list of bookmarks that appears has the oldest bookmarks on the top. I want the newest bookmarks on top. How can I do that?
creator: astrickland

title: session files stop updating, open session is not fresh!
content: There is a problem that has haunted me for many years, regardless of the versions of firefox, the bottom line is that when I close the browser after a long work, and open it later, an outdated session is restored, 4-5 hours old, and not the last one. Having watched the "sessionstore-backups" folder and its three files, I found that at some point these files simply stop changing, so the next time the browser is opened, the session is not fresh. Why is this happening, I cannot understand why the session files freeze and do not update despite the fact that I continue to work in firefox ??
creator: vad-athlon
